intro: Roemeria hybrida var. velutinoeriocarpa, commonly known as the velvet-fruited roemeria, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that are soft to the touch, giving it a velvety appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its fruits are small, dry, and covered in a fine, hairy layer, contributing to its specific variety name. This plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
